content:
With 7-10 days, you can definitely explore some amazing destinations along the West Coast. Given your preferences, I've put together a suggested itinerary for you:

Day 1-2: San Francisco, California

* Drive from your starting point to San Francisco (approx. 2-3 hours from the Bay Area)
* Explore Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, and the Golden Gate Bridge
* Take a bike ride across the Golden Gate Bridge to Sausalito (bike rentals available)
* Enjoy the vibrant food scene in the Mission District or Haight-Ashbury

Day 3-4: Redwood National and State Parks, California

* Drive to Redwood National and State Parks (approx. 4 hours)
* Hike among the tallest trees on earth, including the Lady Bird Johnson Grove Trail
* Bike on the Redwood Highway (Hwy 101) or take a scenic drive through the Avenue of the Giants
* Camp or stay in nearby Eureka or Arcata

Day 5-6: Oregon Coast, Oregon

* Drive to the Oregon Coast (approx. 4.5 hours)
* Explore Cannon Beach, with its iconic Haystack Rock and scenic coastal trails
* Bike the Cannon Beach Trail or ride south to Ecola State Park for stunning views
* Enjoy fresh seafood and craft beer in Seaside or Astoria

Day 7-8: Olympic National Park, Washington

* Drive to Olympic National Park (approx. 4.5 hours)
* Hike through the Hoh Rainforest or explore the rugged coastline at Ruby Beach
* Bike the Olympic Discovery Trail, which spans 130 miles (bike rentals available)
* Visit the charming town of Port Angeles for food and drinks

Day 9-10: Seattle, Washington

* Drive to Seattle (approx. 2 hours)
* Explore the iconic Space Needle, Pike Place Market, and the waterfront
* Bike the Seattle Waterfront Path or take a ferry ride to Bainbridge Island
* Enjoy the city's vibrant food scene, including coffee, seafood, and music venues

This itinerary offers a mix of national parks, beaches, and cities, with plenty of opportunities for hiking, biking, and enjoying local food and drinks. You can adjust the pace to fit your preferences, and consider adding or removing days depending on your interests.

Some additional bike-friendly tips and suggestions:

* Bring a bike rack or rent bikes at each location to make the most of your trip.
* Research bike trails and routes in advance to ensure they're suitable for your skill level and interests.
* Consider downloading bike route apps like MapMyRide or Ride with GPS to help navigate.
* Don't forget to pack bike safety gear, including a helmet, lights, and reflective gear.

Feel free to ask if you have any questions or need more recommendations!
